definitions.sensetop: in the midst of somethingfrom the midst of something

examples.text: Such beauty was unexpected in the midst of the city.
The house is set in the midst of large gardens.
She appeared from the midst of the crowd.
There is a traitor in our midst.

definitions.definition: while something is happening or being done; while you are doing something

examples.text: a country in the midst of a recession
She discovered it in the midst of sorting out her father's things.
She alone remained calm in the midst of all the confusion.

wordOrigin: late Middle English: from in middes ‘in the middle’.
